content: So we went from having excess of $200 million of over performance in 2020 and 2021 to being under $100 million this year for the full year, $88 million, and we've continued to sort of get closer to the pen each quarter. Shifting to the purchasing side, I know in years past, you've always been quick to caution that any time there is a significant quarterly performance in Europe, regardless of the countries you're buying from, very often, very lumpy that it might be one or two banks unloading some non-performing loans.
